content: 20 or a hunchback or a dwarf, or a spot in his eye or a skin disorder or a skin eruption or a crushed testicle.
content_old: 20 or a hunchback or a dwarf, or a spot in his eye or a skin disorder or a skin eruption or a crushed testicle.

content: 21 Any man from Aaron the priest’s offspring in whom is a physical defect shall not come near to present offerings made by fire to Yahweh; a physical defect is in him; he shall not come near to present his God’s food.
content_old: 21 Any man from Aaron the priest’s offspring in whom is a physical defect shall not come near to present offerings made by fire to Yahweh; a physical defect is in him; he shall not come near to present his God’s food.

content: 22 He may eat his God’s food, from the most holy things and from the holy things.
content_old: 22 He may eat his God’s food, from the most holy things and from the holy things.

content: 23 But he must not enter the curtain, and he must not come near to the altar, because a physical defect is in him, and he must not profane my sanctuary, because I am Yahweh, who consecrates them.’ ”
content_old: 23 But he must not enter the curtain, and he must not come near to the altar, because a physical defect is in him, and he must not profane my sanctuary, because I am Yahweh, who consecrates them.’ ”

content: 1 Then Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,
content_old: 1 Then Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,

content: 2 “Tell Aaron and his sons that they must deal respectfully with the Israelites’ votive offerings, and they must not profane my holy name, which they are consecrating to me; I am Yahweh.
content_old: 2 “Tell Aaron and his sons that they must deal respectfully with the Israelites’ votive offerings, and they must not profane my holy name, which they are consecrating to me; I am Yahweh.

content: 3 “Say to them, ‘Throughout your generations, any man from any of your offspring who comes near the votive offerings that the Israelites consecrate to Yahweh with his uncleanness on him, that person shall be cut off from before me; I am Yahweh.
content_old: 3 “Say to them, ‘Throughout your generations, any man from any of your offspring who comes near the votive offerings that the Israelites consecrate to Yahweh with his uncleanness on him, that person shall be cut off from before me; I am Yahweh.

content: 4 “ ‘Anyone from Aaron’s offspring, if he is afflicted with a skin disease or a fluid discharge, shall not eat in the sanctuary until he is clean; and the one who touches any unclean person or a man from whom an emission of semen goes out,
content_old: 4 “ ‘Anyone from Aaron’s offspring, if he is afflicted with a skin disease or a fluid discharge, shall not eat in the sanctuary until he is clean; and the one who touches any unclean person or a man from whom an emission of semen goes out,

content: 5 or a man who touches any swarmer that is unclean for him or who touches a person who is unclean for him due to whatever his uncleanness,
content_old: 5 or a man who touches any swarmer that is unclean for him or who touches a person who is unclean for him due to whatever his uncleanness,

content: 6 a person who touches such a thing shall be unclean until the evening, and he shall not eat from the votive offerings, except when he washes his body with water
content_old: 6 a person who touches such a thing shall be unclean until the evening, and he shall not eat from the votive offerings, except when he washes his body with water

content: 7 and the sun sets, and he shall be clean; then afterward he may eat from the votive offerings, because it is his food.
content_old: 7 and the sun sets, and he shall be clean; then afterward he may eat from the votive offerings, because it is his food.

content: 8 He shall not eat a naturally dead body or a mangled carcass, so that he becomes unclean by it; I am Yahweh.
content_old: 8 He shall not eat a naturally dead body or a mangled carcass, so that he becomes unclean by it; I am Yahweh.

content: 9 “ ‘And they shall keep my obligation, and they shall not incur guilt because of it, so that they die through it, because they have profaned it; I am Yahweh who consecrates them.
content_old: 9 “ ‘And they shall keep my obligation, and they shall not incur guilt because of it, so that they die through it, because they have profaned it; I am Yahweh who consecrates them.

content: 10 “ ‘No stranger shall eat the votive offering; nor shall a temporary resident with a priest or a hired worker eat the votive offering.
content_old: 10 “ ‘No stranger shall eat the votive offering; nor shall a temporary resident with a priest or a hired worker eat the votive offering.

content: 11 But a priest, if with his money he buys a person as his possession, that one may eat it, and the descendants of his house themselves may eat his food.
content_old: 11 But a priest, if with his money he buys a person as his possession, that one may eat it, and the descendants of his house themselves may eat his food.

content: 12 And a priest’s daughter, when she marries a layman, she herself may not eat the votive offering.
content_old: 12 And a priest’s daughter, when she marries a layman, she herself may not eat the votive offering.

content: 13 But a priest’s daughter, when she becomes a widow or divorced or there is no offspring for her, and she returns to her father’s house as in her childhood, she may eat from her father’s food, but no layman may eat it.
content_old: 13 But a priest’s daughter, when she becomes a widow or divorced or there is no offspring for her, and she returns to her father’s house as in her childhood, she may eat from her father’s food, but no layman may eat it.

content: 14 And if a man eats the votive offering unintentionally, then he shall add to it a fifth of it, and he shall give the votive offering to the priest.
content_old: 14 And if a man eats the votive offering unintentionally, then he shall add to it a fifth of it, and he shall give the votive offering to the priest.

content: 15 And they shall not profane the Israelites’ votive offerings that they present to Yahweh,
content_old: 15 And they shall not profane the Israelites’ votive offerings that they present to Yahweh,

content: 16 and so cause them, by their eating their votive offerings, to bear guilt requiring a guilt offering, because I am Yahweh, who consecrates them.’ ”
content_old: 16 and so cause them, by their eating their votive offerings, to bear guilt requiring a guilt offering, because I am Yahweh, who consecrates them.’ ”

content: 17 Then Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,
content_old: 17 Then Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,

content: 18 “Speak to Aaron and to his sons and to all the Israelites, and say to them, ‘Anyone from the house of Israel or from the alien in Israel who presents his offering for any of their vows or for any of their freewill offerings that they present to Yahweh as a burnt offering,
content_old: 18 “Speak to Aaron and to his sons and to all the Israelites, and say to them, ‘Anyone from the house of Israel or from the alien in Israel who presents his offering for any of their vows or for any of their freewill offerings that they present to Yahweh as a burnt offering,

content: 19 it must be without defect to be acceptable for you: a male among the cattle, among the sheep, or among the goats.
content_old: 19 it must be without defect to be acceptable for you: a male among the cattle, among the sheep, or among the goats.

content: 20 You shall not present any animal in which is a physical defect, because it shall not be acceptable for you.
content_old: 20 You shall not present any animal in which is a physical defect, because it shall not be acceptable for you.

content: 21 And if anyone brings a sacrifice of fellowship offerings for Yahweh to fulfill a vow or as a freewill offering from the cattle or from the flock, it must be without defect to be acceptable; there must not be any physical defect in it.
content_old: 21 And if anyone brings a sacrifice of fellowship offerings for Yahweh to fulfill a vow or as a freewill offering from the cattle or from the flock, it must be without defect to be acceptable; there must not be any physical defect in it.

content: 22 The blind or the injured or the maimed or the seeping or one with a skin disorder or one with a skin eruption—these you shall not present to Yahweh, nor shall you give from them an offering made by fire on the altar for Yahweh.
content_old: 22 The blind or the injured or the maimed or the seeping or one with a skin disorder or one with a skin eruption—these you shall not present to Yahweh, nor shall you give from them an offering made by fire on the altar for Yahweh.

content: 23 As for an ox or sheep that is deformed or that is stunted, you may present it as a freewill offering, but for a vow it will not be accepted.
content_old: 23 As for an ox or sheep that is deformed or that is stunted, you may present it as a freewill offering, but for a vow it will not be accepted.

content: 24 And you shall not present anything for Yahweh with bruised or shattered or torn or cut-off testicles, and you shall not sacrifice such in your land.
content_old: 24 And you shall not present anything for Yahweh with bruised or shattered or torn or cut-off testicles, and you shall not sacrifice such in your land.

content: 25 And you shall not present your God’s food from any of these by the hand of a foreigner, because their deformity is in them; a physical defect is in them; they shall not be accepted for you.’ ”
content_old: 25 And you shall not present your God’s food from any of these by the hand of a foreigner, because their deformity is in them; a physical defect is in them; they shall not be accepted for you.’ ”

content: 26 Then Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,
content_old: 26 Then Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,

content: 27 “When an ox or a sheep or a goat is born, then it shall be under its mother for seven days, and from the eighth day and beyond it is acceptable as an offering made by fire for Yahweh.
content_old: 27 “When an ox or a sheep or a goat is born, then it shall be under its mother for seven days, and from the eighth day and beyond it is acceptable as an offering made by fire for Yahweh.

content: 28 And you shall not slaughter an ox or a sheep and its young on the same day.
content_old: 28 And you shall not slaughter an ox or a sheep and its young on the same day.

content: 29 And when you sacrifice a sacrifice of thanksgiving to Yahweh, you must sacrifice it to be acceptable for you.
content_old: 29 And when you sacrifice a sacrifice of thanksgiving to Yahweh, you must sacrifice it to be acceptable for you.

content: 30 It must be eaten on that day; you must not leave over anything from it until morning; I am Yahweh.
content_old: 30 It must be eaten on that day; you must not leave over anything from it until morning; I am Yahweh.

content: 31 “Thus you shall keep my commands, and you shall do them; I am Yahweh.
content_old: 31 “Thus you shall keep my commands, and you shall do them; I am Yahweh.

content: 32 “And you shall not profane my holy name, so that I may be consecrated in the midst of the Israelites; I am Yahweh, who consecrates you,
content_old: 32 “And you shall not profane my holy name, so that I may be consecrated in the midst of the Israelites; I am Yahweh, who consecrates you,

content: 1 Then Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,
content_old: 1 Then Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,

content: 2 “Speak to the Israelites, and say to them, ‘The festivals of Yahweh that you shall proclaim are holy assemblies; these are my appointed times.
content_old: 2 “Speak to the Israelites, and say to them, ‘The festivals of Yahweh that you shall proclaim are holy assemblies; these are my appointed times.

content: 3 “ ‘For six days work is to be done, and on the seventh day shall be a Sabbath of complete rest, a holy assembly; you shall not do any work; it shall be a Sabbath for Yahweh in all your dwellings.
content_old: 3 “ ‘For six days work is to be done, and on the seventh day shall be a Sabbath of complete rest, a holy assembly; you shall not do any work; it shall be a Sabbath for Yahweh in all your dwellings.

content: 4 “ ‘These are Yahweh’s appointed times, holy assemblies, which you shall proclaim at their appointed time.
content_old: 4 “ ‘These are Yahweh’s appointed times, holy assemblies, which you shall proclaim at their appointed time.

content: 5 In the first month, on the fourteenth of the month at the evening is Yahweh’s Passover.
content_old: 5 In the first month, on the fourteenth of the month at the evening is Yahweh’s Passover.

content: 6 And on the fifteenth day of this month is Yahweh’s Feast of Unleavened Bread; for seven days you shall eat unleavened bread.
content_old: 6 And on the fifteenth day of this month is Yahweh’s Feast of Unleavened Bread; for seven days you shall eat unleavened bread.

content: 7 On the first day there shall be a holy assembly for you; you shall not do any regular work.
content_old: 7 On the first day there shall be a holy assembly for you; you shall not do any regular work.

content: 8 And you shall present an offering for Yahweh made by fire for seven days; on the seventh day there shall be a holy assembly; you shall not do any regular work.’ ”
content_old: 8 And you shall present an offering for Yahweh made by fire for seven days; on the seventh day there shall be a holy assembly; you shall not do any regular work.’ ”

content: 9 Then Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,
content_old: 9 Then Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,

content: 10 “Speak to the Israelites, and say to them, ‘When you come to the land that I am about to give to you and you reap its harvest, then you shall bring a sheaf of the firstfruit of your harvest to the priest.
content_old: 10 “Speak to the Israelites, and say to them, ‘When you come to the land that I am about to give to you and you reap its harvest, then you shall bring a sheaf of the firstfruit of your harvest to the priest.

content: 11 And he shall wave the sheaf before Yahweh for your acceptance; the priest shall wave it on the day after the Sabbath.
content_old: 11 And he shall wave the sheaf before Yahweh for your acceptance; the priest shall wave it on the day after the Sabbath.

content: 12 And on the day of your waving the sheaf you shall offer a yearling male lamb without defect as a burnt offering to Yahweh.
content_old: 12 And on the day of your waving the sheaf you shall offer a yearling male lamb without defect as a burnt offering to Yahweh.

content: 13 And its grain offering shall be two-tenths of an ephah of finely milled flour mixed with oil, an offering made by fire for Yahweh, an appeasing fragrance; and its libation shall be a fourth of a hin of wine.
content_old: 13 And its grain offering shall be two-tenths of an ephah of finely milled flour mixed with oil, an offering made by fire for Yahweh, an appeasing fragrance; and its libation shall be a fourth of a hin of wine.

content: 14 And you shall not eat bread or roasted grain or ripe grain until this very same day, until you present your God’s offering. This must be a lasting statute for your generations in all your dwellings.
content_old: 14 And you shall not eat bread or roasted grain or ripe grain until this very same day, until you present your God’s offering. This must be a lasting statute for your generations in all your dwellings.

content: 15 “ ‘And you shall count for yourselves from the day after the Sabbath, from the day of your bringing the wave offering’s sheaf—there shall be seven full weeks.
content_old: 15 “ ‘And you shall count for yourselves from the day after the Sabbath, from the day of your bringing the wave offering’s sheaf—there shall be seven full weeks.

content: 16 Until the day after the seventh Sabbath you shall count fifty days; then you shall present a new grain offering for Yahweh.
content_old: 16 Until the day after the seventh Sabbath you shall count fifty days; then you shall present a new grain offering for Yahweh.

content: 17 You shall bring from your dwellings for a wave offering two loaves of bread made with two-tenths of an ephah of finely milled flour; they must be baked with leaven—the firstfruits belonging to Yahweh.
content_old: 17 You shall bring from your dwellings for a wave offering two loaves of bread made with two-tenths of an ephah of finely milled flour; they must be baked with leaven—the firstfruits belonging to Yahweh.

content: 18 And, in addition to the bread, you shall present seven yearling male lambs without defects and one young bull and two rams—they shall be a burnt offering for Yahweh with their grain offering and their libations, an offering made by fire, an appeasing fragrance for Yahweh.
content_old: 18 And, in addition to the bread, you shall present seven yearling male lambs without defects and one young bull and two rams—they shall be a burnt offering for Yahweh with their grain offering and their libations, an offering made by fire, an appeasing fragrance for Yahweh.

content: 19 And you shall offer one he-goat as a sin offering and two yearling male lambs as a sacrifice of fellowship offerings.
content_old: 19 And you shall offer one he-goat as a sin offering and two yearling male lambs as a sacrifice of fellowship offerings.

content: 20 And the priest shall wave them with the bread of the firstfruits as a wave offering before Yahweh; in addition to the two male lambs, they shall be holy for Yahweh for the priest.
content_old: 20 And the priest shall wave them with the bread of the firstfruits as a wave offering before Yahweh; in addition to the two male lambs, they shall be holy for Yahweh for the priest.

content: 21 And you shall make a proclamation on this very same day; it shall be a holy assembly for you; you shall not do any regular work; this is a lasting statute in all your dwellings throughout your generations.
content_old: 21 And you shall make a proclamation on this very same day; it shall be a holy assembly for you; you shall not do any regular work; this is a lasting statute in all your dwellings throughout your generations.

content: 22 And when you reap the harvest of your land, you must not finish the edge of your field at your reaping, and you must not glean the remnants of your harvest—you shall leave them behind for the needy and for the alien; I am Yahweh your God.’ ”
content_old: 22 And when you reap the harvest of your land, you must not finish the edge of your field at your reaping, and you must not glean the remnants of your harvest—you shall leave them behind for the needy and for the alien; I am Yahweh your God.’ ”

content: 23 Then Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,
content_old: 23 Then Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,

content: 24 “Speak to the Israelites, saying, ‘In the seventh month, on the first day of the month, you must have a rest period, a remembrance of the trumpet blast, a holy assembly.
content_old: 24 “Speak to the Israelites, saying, ‘In the seventh month, on the first day of the month, you must have a rest period, a remembrance of the trumpet blast, a holy assembly.

content: 25 You must not do any regular work, and you shall present an offering made by fire to Yahweh.’ ”
content_old: 25 You must not do any regular work, and you shall present an offering made by fire to Yahweh.’ ”

content: 26 Then Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,
content_old: 26 Then Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,

content: 27 “Surely the Day of Atonement is on the tenth day of the seventh month; it shall be a holy assembly for you, and you shall deny yourselves, and you shall present an offering made by fire to Yahweh.
content_old: 27 “Surely the Day of Atonement is on the tenth day of the seventh month; it shall be a holy assembly for you, and you shall deny yourselves, and you shall present an offering made by fire to Yahweh.

content: 28 And you must not do any regular work on this very same day, because it is the Day of Atonement to make atonement for you before Yahweh your God.
content_old: 28 And you must not do any regular work on this very same day, because it is the Day of Atonement to make atonement for you before Yahweh your God.

content: 29 If there is any person who does not deny himself on this very same day, then he shall be cut off from his people.
content_old: 29 If there is any person who does not deny himself on this very same day, then he shall be cut off from his people.

content: 30 As for any person who does any work on this very same day, I will exterminate that person from the midst of his people.
content_old: 30 As for any person who does any work on this very same day, I will exterminate that person from the midst of his people.

content: 31 You must not do any work; it is a lasting statute throughout your generations in all your dwellings.
content_old: 31 You must not do any work; it is a lasting statute throughout your generations in all your dwellings.

content: 32 It is a Sabbath of complete rest for you, and you shall deny yourselves on the ninth day of the month in the evening—from evening to evening you must observe your extraordinary Sabbath.”
content_old: 32 It is a Sabbath of complete rest for you, and you shall deny yourselves on the ninth day of the month in the evening—from evening to evening you must observe your extraordinary Sabbath.”

content: 33 Then Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,
content_old: 33 Then Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,

content: 34 “Speak to the Israelites, saying, ‘On the fifteenth day of the seventh month, this shall be the Feast of Booths for seven days for Yahweh.
content_old: 34 “Speak to the Israelites, saying, ‘On the fifteenth day of the seventh month, this shall be the Feast of Booths for seven days for Yahweh.

content: 35 On the first day there shall be a holy assembly; you must not do any regular work.
content_old: 35 On the first day there shall be a holy assembly; you must not do any regular work.

content: 36 For seven days you must present an offering made by fire to Yahweh. On the eighth day it shall be a holy assembly for you, and you shall present an offering made by fire to Yahweh; it is a celebration; you must not do any regular work.
content_old: 36 For seven days you must present an offering made by fire to Yahweh. On the eighth day it shall be a holy assembly for you, and you shall present an offering made by fire to Yahweh; it is a celebration; you must not do any regular work.

content: 37 “ ‘These are Yahweh’s festivals, which you must proclaim, holy assemblies to present an offering made by fire to Yahweh—burnt offering and grain offering, sacrifice and libations, each on its proper day—
content_old: 37 “ ‘These are Yahweh’s festivals, which you must proclaim, holy assemblies to present an offering made by fire to Yahweh—burnt offering and grain offering, sacrifice and libations, each on its proper day—

content: 38 besides Yahweh’s Sabbaths and besides your gifts and besides your vows and besides all your freewill offerings that you give to Yahweh.
content_old: 38 besides Yahweh’s Sabbaths and besides your gifts and besides your vows and besides all your freewill offerings that you give to Yahweh.

content: 39 “ ‘Surely on the fifteenth day of the seventh month, at your gathering the land’s produce, you shall hold Yahweh’s festival for seven days; on the first day there shall be a rest period and on the eighth day a rest period.
content_old: 39 “ ‘Surely on the fifteenth day of the seventh month, at your gathering the land’s produce, you shall hold Yahweh’s festival for seven days; on the first day there shall be a rest period and on the eighth day a rest period.

content: 40 And on the first day you shall take for yourselves the first fruit of majestic trees, branches of palm trees and branches of a leafy tree and of a brook’s poplar trees, and you shall rejoice before Yahweh your God for seven days.
content_old: 40 And on the first day you shall take for yourselves the first fruit of majestic trees, branches of palm trees and branches of a leafy tree and of a brook’s poplar trees, and you shall rejoice before Yahweh your God for seven days.

content: 41 And you must hold it as a festival for Yahweh for seven days in the year; it shall be a lasting statute throughout your generations; in the seventh month you must hold it.
content_old: 41 And you must hold it as a festival for Yahweh for seven days in the year; it shall be a lasting statute throughout your generations; in the seventh month you must hold it.

content: 42 You must live in the booths for seven days; all the natives in Israel must live in the booths,
content_old: 42 You must live in the booths for seven days; all the natives in Israel must live in the booths,

content: 43 so that your generations shall know that I made the Israelites live in booths when I brought them from the land of Egypt; I am Yahweh your God.’ ”
content_old: 43 so that your generations shall know that I made the Israelites live in booths when I brought them from the land of Egypt; I am Yahweh your God.’ ”

content: 1 Then Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,
content_old: 1 Then Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,

content: 2 “Command the Israelites that they should bring to you pure olive oil from beaten olives for the light to present a lamp continually.
content_old: 2 “Command the Israelites that they should bring to you pure olive oil from beaten olives for the light to present a lamp continually.

content: 3 Aaron shall arrange for it outside the curtain of the testimony in the tent of assembly from evening until morning before Yahweh continually; it shall be a lasting statute throughout your generations.
content_old: 3 Aaron shall arrange for it outside the curtain of the testimony in the tent of assembly from evening until morning before Yahweh continually; it shall be a lasting statute throughout your generations.

content: 4 On the pure golden lampstand he shall arrange for the lamps before Yahweh continually.
content_old: 4 On the pure golden lampstand he shall arrange for the lamps before Yahweh continually.

content: 5 “And you shall take finely milled flour, and you shall bake with it twelve ring-shaped bread cakes: each one shall be two-tenths of an ephah.
content_old: 5 “And you shall take finely milled flour, and you shall bake with it twelve ring-shaped bread cakes: each one shall be two-tenths of an ephah.

content: 6 And you shall place them in two rows, six to the row, on the pure gold table before Yahweh.
content_old: 6 And you shall place them in two rows, six to the row, on the pure gold table before Yahweh.

content: 7 And you shall put pure frankincense on each row so that it shall be for the bread as a memorial offering, an offering made by fire for Yahweh.
content_old: 7 And you shall put pure frankincense on each row so that it shall be for the bread as a memorial offering, an offering made by fire for Yahweh.

content: 8 On every Sabbath he shall arrange it in rows before Yahweh continually; they are from the Israelites as an everlasting covenant.
content_old: 8 On every Sabbath he shall arrange it in rows before Yahweh continually; they are from the Israelites as an everlasting covenant.

content: 9 And it shall be for Aaron and for his sons, and they shall eat it in a holy place, because it is a most holy thing for him from Yahweh’s offerings made by fire—a lasting rule.”
content_old: 9 And it shall be for Aaron and for his sons, and they shall eat it in a holy place, because it is a most holy thing for him from Yahweh’s offerings made by fire—a lasting rule.”

content: 10 And an Israelite woman’s son, and he was an Egyptian man’s son, went out in the midst of the Israelites; and the Israelite woman’s son and an Israelite man fought in the camp.
content_old: 10 And an Israelite woman’s son, and he was an Egyptian man’s son, went out in the midst of the Israelites; and the Israelite woman’s son and an Israelite man fought in the camp.

content: 11 Then the Israelite woman’s son blasphemed the name, and he cursed, so they brought him to Moses—and the name of his mother was Shelomith the daughter of Dibri, of the tribe of Dan.
content_old: 11 Then the Israelite woman’s son blasphemed the name, and he cursed, so they brought him to Moses—and the name of his mother was Shelomith the daughter of Dibri, of the tribe of Dan.

content: 12 Then they put him in custody so that the matter might be made clear to them in accordance with the mouth of Yahweh.
content_old: 12 Then they put him in custody so that the matter might be made clear to them in accordance with the mouth of Yahweh.

content: 13 Then Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,
content_old: 13 Then Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,

content: 14 “Bring the curser outside the camp, and all the hearers shall place their hands on his head, and the whole community shall stone him.
content_old: 14 “Bring the curser outside the camp, and all the hearers shall place their hands on his head, and the whole community shall stone him.

content: 15 And you shall speak to the Israelites, saying, ‘Any man when he curses his God shall bear his sin.
content_old: 15 And you shall speak to the Israelites, saying, ‘Any man when he curses his God shall bear his sin.

content: 16 And he who blasphemes Yahweh’s name certainly shall be put to death; the whole community certainly shall stone him. As the alien, so the native shall be put to death at blaspheming his name.
content_old: 16 And he who blasphemes Yahweh’s name certainly shall be put to death; the whole community certainly shall stone him. As the alien, so the native shall be put to death at blaspheming his name.

content: 17 “ ‘And when a man kills any human being, he certainly shall be put to death.
content_old: 17 “ ‘And when a man kills any human being, he certainly shall be put to death.

content: 18 And he who kills a domestic animal must repay for it life in place of life.
content_old: 18 And he who kills a domestic animal must repay for it life in place of life.

content: 19 And when a man causes a physical defect in his fellow citizen according to what he has done, so it shall be done to him:
content_old: 19 And when a man causes a physical defect in his fellow citizen according to what he has done, so it shall be done to him:

content: 20 fracture in place of fracture, eye in place of eye, tooth in place of tooth—according to the physical defect he causes to the person, likewise it shall be caused to him.
content_old: 20 fracture in place of fracture, eye in place of eye, tooth in place of tooth—according to the physical defect he causes to the person, likewise it shall be caused to him.

content: 21 And a killer of a domestic animal must repay for it, and a killer of a human shall be put to death.
content_old: 21 And a killer of a domestic animal must repay for it, and a killer of a human shall be put to death.

content: 22 You must have one norm; as for the alien, so it must be for the native, because I am Yahweh your God.’ ”
content_old: 22 You must have one norm; as for the alien, so it must be for the native, because I am Yahweh your God.’ ”

content: 1 Then Yahweh spoke to Moses on Mount Sinai, saying,
content_old: 1 Then Yahweh spoke to Moses on Mount Sinai, saying,

content: 2 “Speak to the Israelites, and say to them, ‘When you come into the land that I am about to give to you, then the land shall observe a Sabbath for Yahweh.
content_old: 2 “Speak to the Israelites, and say to them, ‘When you come into the land that I am about to give to you, then the land shall observe a Sabbath for Yahweh.

content: 3 Six years you shall sow your field, and six years you shall prune your vineyard, and you shall gather its yield.
content_old: 3 Six years you shall sow your field, and six years you shall prune your vineyard, and you shall gather its yield.

content: 4 But in the seventh year it shall be a Sabbath of complete rest for the land—a Sabbath for Yahweh; you must not sow your field, and you must not prune your vineyard.
content_old: 4 But in the seventh year it shall be a Sabbath of complete rest for the land—a Sabbath for Yahweh; you must not sow your field, and you must not prune your vineyard.

content: 5 You must not reap your harvest’s aftergrowth, and you must not harvest the grapes of your unpruned vines—it shall be a year of complete rest for the land.
content_old: 5 You must not reap your harvest’s aftergrowth, and you must not harvest the grapes of your unpruned vines—it shall be a year of complete rest for the land.

content: 6 And a Sabbath of the land shall be for food for you: for you and for your slave and for your slave woman and for your hired worker and for your temporary residents who are dwelling as aliens with you;
content_old: 6 And a Sabbath of the land shall be for food for you: for you and for your slave and for your slave woman and for your hired worker and for your temporary residents who are dwelling as aliens with you;

content: 7 and all its yield shall be for your domestic animal and for the wild animal, which are in your land to eat.
content_old: 7 and all its yield shall be for your domestic animal and for the wild animal, which are in your land to eat.

content: 8 “ ‘And you shall count for yourself seven Sabbaths of years, seven times seven years, and they shall be for you time periods of seven Sabbaths of years: forty-nine years.
content_old: 8 “ ‘And you shall count for yourself seven Sabbaths of years, seven times seven years, and they shall be for you time periods of seven Sabbaths of years: forty-nine years.

content: 9 And you shall cause a loud horn blast to be heard on the seventh month on the tenth of the month; on the Day of Atonement you shall cause a ram’s horn to be heard in all your land.
content_old: 9 And you shall cause a loud horn blast to be heard on the seventh month on the tenth of the month; on the Day of Atonement you shall cause a ram’s horn to be heard in all your land.

content: 10 And you shall consecrate the fiftieth year, and you shall proclaim a release in the land for all its inhabitants. It is a Jubilee; it shall be for you, and you shall return. You must return—everyone to his property and everyone to his clan.
content_old: 10 And you shall consecrate the fiftieth year, and you shall proclaim a release in the land for all its inhabitants. It is a Jubilee; it shall be for you, and you shall return. You must return—everyone to his property and everyone to his clan.

content: 11 You shall have the fiftieth year as a Jubilee; you must not sow and you must not reap its aftergrowth, and you must not harvest its unpruned vines.
content_old: 11 You shall have the fiftieth year as a Jubilee; you must not sow and you must not reap its aftergrowth, and you must not harvest its unpruned vines.

content: 12 Because it is a Jubilee, it shall be holy to you. You must eat its produce from the field.
content_old: 12 Because it is a Jubilee, it shall be holy to you. You must eat its produce from the field.

content: 13 “ ‘In this Year of Jubilee each of you shall return to his property.
content_old: 13 “ ‘In this Year of Jubilee each of you shall return to his property.

content: 14 And when you sell something to your fellow citizen or you buy from your neighbor’s hand, you must not oppress one another.
content_old: 14 And when you sell something to your fellow citizen or you buy from your neighbor’s hand, you must not oppress one another.

content: 15 You must buy from your fellow citizen according to the number of years after the Jubilee; he must sell to you according to the number of years of yield.
content_old: 15 You must buy from your fellow citizen according to the number of years after the Jubilee; he must sell to you according to the number of years of yield.

content: 16 You must increase its price according to a greater number of years, but you must decrease its price according to a lesser number of years, because he is selling its yields to you.
content_old: 16 You must increase its price according to a greater number of years, but you must decrease its price according to a lesser number of years, because he is selling its yields to you.

content: 17 And you must not oppress one another, but you shall revere your God, because I am Yahweh, your God.
content_old: 17 And you must not oppress one another, but you shall revere your God, because I am Yahweh, your God.

content: 18 “ ‘And you shall do my statutes, and you must keep my regulations, and you shall do them, so that you shall live securely on the land.
content_old: 18 “ ‘And you shall do my statutes, and you must keep my regulations, and you shall do them, so that you shall live securely on the land.

content: 19 And the land shall give its fruit, and you shall eat your fill, and you shall live securely on it.
content_old: 19 And the land shall give its fruit, and you shall eat your fill, and you shall live securely on it.

content: 20 And if you should say, “What shall we eat in the seventh year, if we do not sow and we do not gather its yield?”
content_old: 20 And if you should say, “What shall we eat in the seventh year, if we do not sow and we do not gather its yield?”

content: 21 then I will command my blessing for you in the sixth year, so that it will make the yield for three years.
content_old: 21 then I will command my blessing for you in the sixth year, so that it will make the yield for three years.

content: 22 And you will sow in the eighth year, and you shall eat from the old yield; until the ninth year, until the coming of its yield, you shall eat the old yield.
content_old: 22 And you will sow in the eighth year, and you shall eat from the old yield; until the ninth year, until the coming of its yield, you shall eat the old yield.

content: 23 “ ‘But the land must not be sold in perpetuity, because the land is mine, because you are aliens and temporary residents with me.
content_old: 23 “ ‘But the land must not be sold in perpetuity, because the land is mine, because you are aliens and temporary residents with me.

content: 24 And in all your property’s land you must provide redemption for the land.
content_old: 24 And in all your property’s land you must provide redemption for the land.

content: 25 “ ‘When your brother becomes poor and he sells part of his property, then his nearest redeemer shall come, and he shall redeem the thing sold by his brother.
content_old: 25 “ ‘When your brother becomes poor and he sells part of his property, then his nearest redeemer shall come, and he shall redeem the thing sold by his brother.

content: 26 But if a man does not have a redeemer, then he prospers and he finds enough for his redemption,
content_old: 26 But if a man does not have a redeemer, then he prospers and he finds enough for his redemption,

content: 27 then he shall calculate the years of its selling, and he shall refund the balance to the man to whom he sold it, and he shall return to his property.
content_old: 27 then he shall calculate the years of its selling, and he shall refund the balance to the man to whom he sold it, and he shall return to his property.

content: 28 But if his hand does not find enough to refund to him, then what he has sold shall be in the buyer’s hand until the Year of Jubilee; and it shall go out of the buyer’s hand in the Jubilee, and he shall return to his property.
content_old: 28 But if his hand does not find enough to refund to him, then what he has sold shall be in the buyer’s hand until the Year of Jubilee; and it shall go out of the buyer’s hand in the Jubilee, and he shall return to his property.

content: 29 “ ‘And if a man sells a residential house in a walled city, then it shall be his redemption until completing a year after his selling; its redemption shall last a year.
content_old: 29 “ ‘And if a man sells a residential house in a walled city, then it shall be his redemption until completing a year after his selling; its redemption shall last a year.

content: 30 But if it is not redeemed before a full year has passed, then the house that is in the walled city shall belong to the buyer in perpetuity throughout his generations; it shall not go out of the buyer’s hand in the Jubilee.
content_old: 30 But if it is not redeemed before a full year has passed, then the house that is in the walled city shall belong to the buyer in perpetuity throughout his generations; it shall not go out of the buyer’s hand in the Jubilee.

content: 31 However, village houses that have no surrounding wall shall be considered open country; there is redemption for it, and in the Jubilee it shall go out of the buyer’s hand.
content_old: 31 However, village houses that have no surrounding wall shall be considered open country; there is redemption for it, and in the Jubilee it shall go out of the buyer’s hand.

content: 32 “ ‘As for the cities of the Levites, that is, the houses in their property’s cities, it shall be a lasting redemption for the Levites.
content_old: 32 “ ‘As for the cities of the Levites, that is, the houses in their property’s cities, it shall be a lasting redemption for the Levites.

content: 33 And whatever anyone redeems from the Levites then must go out of the buyer’s hand in the Jubilee, including a house’s selling in his city’s property, because the houses in the cities of the Levites are their property in the midst of the Israelites.
content_old: 33 And whatever anyone redeems from the Levites then must go out of the buyer’s hand in the Jubilee, including a house’s selling in his city’s property, because the houses in the cities of the Levites are their property in the midst of the Israelites.

content: 34 But a field of their cities’ pastureland must not be sold, because it is their property for all time.
content_old: 34 But a field of their cities’ pastureland must not be sold, because it is their property for all time.

content: 35 “ ‘And if your countryman becomes poor and if he becomes dependent on you, then you shall support him like an alien and like a temporary resident, and he shall live with you.
content_old: 35 “ ‘And if your countryman becomes poor and if he becomes dependent on you, then you shall support him like an alien and like a temporary resident, and he shall live with you.

content: 36 You must not take interest or usury from him, but you shall revere your God, and your countryman shall live with you.
content_old: 36 You must not take interest or usury from him, but you shall revere your God, and your countryman shall live with you.

content: 37 You must not give your money to him with interest or give your food for profit.
content_old: 37 You must not give your money to him with interest or give your food for profit.

content: 38 I am Yahweh your God, who brought you out from the land of Egypt to give you the land of Canaan, to be as God for you.
content_old: 38 I am Yahweh your God, who brought you out from the land of Egypt to give you the land of Canaan, to be as God for you.

content: 39 “ ‘And if your countryman who is with you becomes poor, and he is sold to you, you shall not treat him as a slave.
content_old: 39 “ ‘And if your countryman who is with you becomes poor, and he is sold to you, you shall not treat him as a slave.

content: 40 He shall be with you like a hired worker, like a temporary resident; he shall work with you until the Year of Jubilee.
content_old: 40 He shall be with you like a hired worker, like a temporary resident; he shall work with you until the Year of Jubilee.

content: 41 And he and his sons with him shall go out from you, and he shall return to his clan, and to the property of his ancestors he shall return.
content_old: 41 And he and his sons with him shall go out from you, and he shall return to his clan, and to the property of his ancestors he shall return.

content: 42 Because they are my servants whom I brought out from the land of Egypt, they shall not be sold as a slave.
content_old: 42 Because they are my servants whom I brought out from the land of Egypt, they shall not be sold as a slave.

content: 43 You shall not rule over him with ruthlessness, but you shall revere your God.
content_old: 43 You shall not rule over him with ruthlessness, but you shall revere your God.

content: 44 “ ‘As for your slave and your slave woman who are yours, from the nations that are all around you, from them you may buy a slave or a slave woman.
content_old: 44 “ ‘As for your slave and your slave woman who are yours, from the nations that are all around you, from them you may buy a slave or a slave woman.

content: 45 And you may buy also from the children of the temporary residents who are dwelling with you as aliens and from their clan who are with you, who have children in your land; indeed, they may be as property for you.
content_old: 45 And you may buy also from the children of the temporary residents who are dwelling with you as aliens and from their clan who are with you, who have children in your land; indeed, they may be as property for you.

content: 46 And you may pass them on as an inheritance to your sons after you to take possession of as property for all time—you may let them work. But as for your countrymen, the Israelites, you shall not rule with ruthlessness over one another.
content_old: 46 And you may pass them on as an inheritance to your sons after you to take possession of as property for all time—you may let them work. But as for your countrymen, the Israelites, you shall not rule with ruthlessness over one another.

content: 47 “ ‘And if the alien or the temporary resident who are with you prosper, but your countryman who is with him becomes poor and he is sold to an alien, a temporary resident who is with you, or to a descendant of an alien’s clan,
content_old: 47 “ ‘And if the alien or the temporary resident who are with you prosper, but your countryman who is with him becomes poor and he is sold to an alien, a temporary resident who is with you, or to a descendant of an alien’s clan,

content: 48 after he is sold redemption shall be for him; one of his brothers may redeem him,
content_old: 48 after he is sold redemption shall be for him; one of his brothers may redeem him,

content: 49 or his uncle or his uncle’s son may redeem him, or one of his close relatives from his clan may redeem him; or if he prospers, he may redeem himself.
content_old: 49 or his uncle or his uncle’s son may redeem him, or one of his close relatives from his clan may redeem him; or if he prospers, he may redeem himself.

content: 50 And he shall calculate with his buyer from the year of his selling himself until the Jubilee; and the value of his selling shall be according to the number of years—it shall be with him like a hired worker’s days.
content_old: 50 And he shall calculate with his buyer from the year of his selling himself until the Jubilee; and the value of his selling shall be according to the number of years—it shall be with him like a hired worker’s days.

content: 51 If there are still many years, in keeping with them he shall restore his redemption in proportion to his purchase price.
content_old: 51 If there are still many years, in keeping with them he shall restore his redemption in proportion to his purchase price.

content: 52 And if there are a few years left until the Year of Jubilee, then he shall calculate for himself; he shall restore his redemption according to the number of his years.
content_old: 52 And if there are a few years left until the Year of Jubilee, then he shall calculate for himself; he shall restore his redemption according to the number of his years.

content: 53 He shall be with him as a yearly hired worker; he shall not rule over him with ruthlessness in your sight.
content_old: 53 He shall be with him as a yearly hired worker; he shall not rule over him with ruthlessness in your sight.

content: 54 And if he is not redeemed by any of these ways, then he and his sons with him shall go out in the Year of Jubilee.
content_old: 54 And if he is not redeemed by any of these ways, then he and his sons with him shall go out in the Year of Jubilee.

content: 1 “ ‘You shall not make for yourselves idols and divine images, and you shall not raise up stone pillars for yourselves, and you shall not put a sculptured stone in your land in order to worship before it, because I am Yahweh your God.
content_old: 1 “ ‘You shall not make for yourselves idols and divine images, and you shall not raise up stone pillars for yourselves, and you shall not put a sculptured stone in your land in order to worship before it, because I am Yahweh your God.

content: 2 “ ‘You shall keep my Sabbaths, and you shall revere my sanctuary; I am Yahweh.
content_old: 2 “ ‘You shall keep my Sabbaths, and you shall revere my sanctuary; I am Yahweh.

content: 3 “ ‘If you walk in my statutes and you keep my commands and you do them,
content_old: 3 “ ‘If you walk in my statutes and you keep my commands and you do them,

content: 4 then I will give you rains in their time, and the land shall give its produce, and the trees of the field shall give their fruit.
content_old: 4 then I will give you rains in their time, and the land shall give its produce, and the trees of the field shall give their fruit.

content: 5 And for you the threshing season shall overtake the grape harvest, and the grape harvest shall overtake the sowing, and you shall eat your food to your fill and you shall live securely in your land.
content_old: 5 And for you the threshing season shall overtake the grape harvest, and the grape harvest shall overtake the sowing, and you shall eat your food to your fill and you shall live securely in your land.

content: 6 And I will give peace in the land, and you shall lie down, and there shall not be anybody who makes you afraid, and I will remove harmful animals from the land, and no sword shall pass through your land.
content_old: 6 And I will give peace in the land, and you shall lie down, and there shall not be anybody who makes you afraid, and I will remove harmful animals from the land, and no sword shall pass through your land.

content: 7 And you shall pursue your enemies, and they shall fall by the sword before you.
content_old: 7 And you shall pursue your enemies, and they shall fall by the sword before you.

content: 8 And five of you shall pursue a hundred, and a hundred of you shall pursue a myriad; and your enemies shall fall by the sword before you.
content_old: 8 And five of you shall pursue a hundred, and a hundred of you shall pursue a myriad; and your enemies shall fall by the sword before you.

content: 9 And I will turn to you, and I will make you fruitful, and I will make you numerous; and I will keep my covenant with you.
content_old: 9 And I will turn to you, and I will make you fruitful, and I will make you numerous; and I will keep my covenant with you.

content: 10 And you shall eat old grain, and you shall clear away the old before the new.
content_old: 10 And you shall eat old grain, and you shall clear away the old before the new.

content: 11 And I will put my dwelling place in your midst, and my inner self shall not abhor you.
content_old: 11 And I will put my dwelling place in your midst, and my inner self shall not abhor you.

content: 12 And I will walk about in your midst, and I shall be your God, and you shall be my people.
content_old: 12 And I will walk about in your midst, and I shall be your God, and you shall be my people.

content: 13 I am Yahweh, your God who brought you out from the land of Egypt, from being their slaves; and I broke the bars of your yoke, and I caused you to walk erectly.
content_old: 13 I am Yahweh, your God who brought you out from the land of Egypt, from being their slaves; and I broke the bars of your yoke, and I caused you to walk erectly.

content: 14 “ ‘But if you do not listen to me and you do not carry out all these commands,
content_old: 14 “ ‘But if you do not listen to me and you do not carry out all these commands,

content: 15 and if you reject my statutes and if your inner self abhors my regulations, to not carry out all my commands by your breaking my covenant,
content_old: 15 and if you reject my statutes and if your inner self abhors my regulations, to not carry out all my commands by your breaking my covenant,

content: 16 I in turn will do this to you: then I will summon onto you horror, the wasting disease, and the fever that wastes eyes and that drains away life; and you shall sow your seed in vain, and your enemies shall eat it.
content_old: 16 I in turn will do this to you: then I will summon onto you horror, the wasting disease, and the fever that wastes eyes and that drains away life; and you shall sow your seed in vain, and your enemies shall eat it.

content: 17 And I will set my face against you, and you shall be defeated before your enemies; and your haters shall rule over you, and you shall flee away, but there shall not be anybody who is pursuing you.
content_old: 17 And I will set my face against you, and you shall be defeated before your enemies; and your haters shall rule over you, and you shall flee away, but there shall not be anybody who is pursuing you.

content: 18 “ ‘And if in spite of these things you do not listen to me, then I will continue to discipline you seven times for your sins.
content_old: 18 “ ‘And if in spite of these things you do not listen to me, then I will continue to discipline you seven times for your sins.

content: 19 And I will break the pride of your strength; and I will make your heaven like iron and your land like copper.
content_old: 19 And I will break the pride of your strength; and I will make your heaven like iron and your land like copper.

content: 20 And your strength shall be consumed in vain; and your land shall not give its produce, and the land’s trees shall not give their fruit.
content_old: 20 And your strength shall be consumed in vain; and your land shall not give its produce, and the land’s trees shall not give their fruit.

content: 21 “ ‘And if you go against me in hostility and you are not willing to listen to me, then I will add a plague onto you seven times according to your sins.
content_old: 21 “ ‘And if you go against me in hostility and you are not willing to listen to me, then I will add a plague onto you seven times according to your sins.

content: 22 And I will send wild animals out among you, and they shall make you childless, and they shall cut down your domestic animals, and they shall make you fewer; and your roads shall be desolate.
content_old: 22 And I will send wild animals out among you, and they shall make you childless, and they shall cut down your domestic animals, and they shall make you fewer; and your roads shall be desolate.

content: 23 “ ‘And if you do not accept correction from me through these things, but you go against me in hostility,
content_old: 23 “ ‘And if you do not accept correction from me through these things, but you go against me in hostility,

content: 24 then I myself will also go against you in hostility, and I myself also will strike you seven times for your sins.
content_old: 24 then I myself will also go against you in hostility, and I myself also will strike you seven times for your sins.

content: 25 And I will bring upon you a sword that seeks vengeance for the covenant, and you shall be gathered to your cities; and I will send a plague in your midst, and you shall be given into the hand of an enemy.
content_old: 25 And I will bring upon you a sword that seeks vengeance for the covenant, and you shall be gathered to your cities; and I will send a plague in your midst, and you shall be given into the hand of an enemy.

content: 26 At my breaking the supply of bread for you, then ten women shall bake your bread in one oven, and they shall return your bread by weight; and you shall eat it, and you shall not be satisfied.
content_old: 26 At my breaking the supply of bread for you, then ten women shall bake your bread in one oven, and they shall return your bread by weight; and you shall eat it, and you shall not be satisfied.

content: 27 “ ‘And if through this you do not listen to me and you go against me in hostility,
content_old: 27 “ ‘And if through this you do not listen to me and you go against me in hostility,

content: 28 then I will go against you in hostile anger, and also I myself will discipline you seven times for your sins.
content_old: 28 then I will go against you in hostile anger, and also I myself will discipline you seven times for your sins.

content: 29 And you shall eat the flesh of your sons; and the flesh of your daughters you shall eat.
content_old: 29 And you shall eat the flesh of your sons; and the flesh of your daughters you shall eat.

content: 30 And I will destroy your high places, and I will cut down your incense altars, and I will place your corpses on your idols’ corpses; and my inner self shall abhor you.
content_old: 30 And I will destroy your high places, and I will cut down your incense altars, and I will place your corpses on your idols’ corpses; and my inner self shall abhor you.

content: 31 And I will lay your cities in ruins, and I will lay waste your sanctuaries; and I shall not smell your sacrifices’ appeasing fragrance.
content_old: 31 And I will lay your cities in ruins, and I will lay waste your sanctuaries; and I shall not smell your sacrifices’ appeasing fragrance.

content: 32 And I myself will lay waste the land, and your enemies who are living in it shall be appalled over it.
content_old: 32 And I myself will lay waste the land, and your enemies who are living in it shall be appalled over it.

content: 33 And I will scatter you among the nations, and I will draw a sword behind you; and your land shall be a desolation, and your cities shall be a ruin.
content_old: 33 And I will scatter you among the nations, and I will draw a sword behind you; and your land shall be a desolation, and your cities shall be a ruin.

content: 34 Then the land shall enjoy its Sabbaths all the days of its lying desolate, and you shall be in the land of your enemies; then the land shall rest, and it shall enjoy its Sabbaths.
content_old: 34 Then the land shall enjoy its Sabbaths all the days of its lying desolate, and you shall be in the land of your enemies; then the land shall rest, and it shall enjoy its Sabbaths.

content: 35 All the days of its lying desolate it shall rest for the time that it had not rested during your Sabbaths while you were living on it.
content_old: 35 All the days of its lying desolate it shall rest for the time that it had not rested during your Sabbaths while you were living on it.

content: 36 As for the ones who remain among you, I will bring fearfulness in their hearts in the land of their enemies; and a sound of a windblown leaf shall pursue them, and they shall flee like flight before a sword, and they shall fall, but there shall not be a pursuer.
content_old: 36 As for the ones who remain among you, I will bring fearfulness in their hearts in the land of their enemies; and a sound of a windblown leaf shall pursue them, and they shall flee like flight before a sword, and they shall fall, but there shall not be a pursuer.

content: 37 And they shall stumble over one another as from before a sword, but there shall not be a pursuer; and you shall have no resistance before your enemies.
content_old: 37 And they shall stumble over one another as from before a sword, but there shall not be a pursuer; and you shall have no resistance before your enemies.

content: 38 And you shall perish among the nations, and the land of your enemies shall eat you.
content_old: 38 And you shall perish among the nations, and the land of your enemies shall eat you.

content: 39 And because of their guilt, the ones among you who remain shall decay in the land of their enemies; and also because of the iniquities of their ancestors, they shall decay with them.
content_old: 39 And because of their guilt, the ones among you who remain shall decay in the land of their enemies; and also because of the iniquities of their ancestors, they shall decay with them.

content: 40 “ ‘But when they confess their guilt and the guilt of their ancestors in their infidelity that they displayed against me, and moreover that they went against me in hostility—
content_old: 40 “ ‘But when they confess their guilt and the guilt of their ancestors in their infidelity that they displayed against me, and moreover that they went against me in hostility—

content: 41 I myself also went against them in hostility, and I brought them into the land of their enemies—or if then their uncircumcised heart is humbled and then they pay for their guilt,
content_old: 41 I myself also went against them in hostility, and I brought them into the land of their enemies—or if then their uncircumcised heart is humbled and then they pay for their guilt,

content: 42 I will remember my covenant with Jacob; and I will remember also my covenant with Isaac and also my covenant with Abraham, and I will remember the land.
content_old: 42 I will remember my covenant with Jacob; and I will remember also my covenant with Isaac and also my covenant with Abraham, and I will remember the land.

content: 43 And the land shall be deserted by them, and it shall enjoy its Sabbaths in its being desolate from them, and they themselves must pay for their guilt, simply because they rejected my regulations, and their inner self abhorred my statutes.
content_old: 43 And the land shall be deserted by them, and it shall enjoy its Sabbaths in its being desolate from them, and they themselves must pay for their guilt, simply because they rejected my regulations, and their inner self abhorred my statutes.

content: 44 And in spite of this, when they are in the land of their enemies I will not reject them, and I will not abhor them to destroy them, to break my covenant with them, because I am Yahweh their God.
content_old: 44 And in spite of this, when they are in the land of their enemies I will not reject them, and I will not abhor them to destroy them, to break my covenant with them, because I am Yahweh their God.

content: 45 And I will remember the first covenant for them—whom I brought out from the land of Egypt in the sight of the nations to be their God. I am Yahweh.’ ”
content_old: 45 And I will remember the first covenant for them—whom I brought out from the land of Egypt in the sight of the nations to be their God. I am Yahweh.’ ”

content: 1 Then Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,
content_old: 1 Then Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,

content: 2 “Speak to the Israelites, and say to them, ‘When a man makes a vow according to your proper value of persons to Yahweh,
content_old: 2 “Speak to the Israelites, and say to them, ‘When a man makes a vow according to your proper value of persons to Yahweh,

content: 3 if your proper value is for a male from twenty years of age up to sixty years of age, then your proper value shall be fifty shekels of money according to the sanctuary’s shekel.
content_old: 3 if your proper value is for a male from twenty years of age up to sixty years of age, then your proper value shall be fifty shekels of money according to the sanctuary’s shekel.

content: 4 But if it is for a female, then your proper value shall be thirty shekels.
content_old: 4 But if it is for a female, then your proper value shall be thirty shekels.

content: 5 And if from five years of age up to twenty years of age, then your proper value shall be twenty shekels for the male and ten shekels for the female.
content_old: 5 And if from five years of age up to twenty years of age, then your proper value shall be twenty shekels for the male and ten shekels for the female.

content: 6 And if from a month of age up to five years of age, then your proper value shall be five shekels of money for the male, and your proper value for the female shall be three shekels of money.
content_old: 6 And if from a month of age up to five years of age, then your proper value shall be five shekels of money for the male, and your proper value for the female shall be three shekels of money.

content: 7 And if from sixty years of age and above: if a male, then your proper value shall be fifteen shekels; and for the female, ten shekels.
content_old: 7 And if from sixty years of age and above: if a male, then your proper value shall be fifteen shekels; and for the female, ten shekels.

content: 8 But if he is poorer than your proper value, then he shall present himself before the priest, and the priest shall set a value on him; the priest shall value him according to what the person who made a vow can afford.
content_old: 8 But if he is poorer than your proper value, then he shall present himself before the priest, and the priest shall set a value on him; the priest shall value him according to what the person who made a vow can afford.

content: 9 “ ‘And if it is a domestic animal from which they present an offering for Yahweh, all that he gives from it for Yahweh shall be a holy object.
content_old: 9 “ ‘And if it is a domestic animal from which they present an offering for Yahweh, all that he gives from it for Yahweh shall be a holy object.

content: 10 He shall not replace it, nor shall he exchange it, either good with bad or bad with good; and if he indeed exchanges a domestic animal with a domestic animal, then it and its substitution shall be a holy object.
content_old: 10 He shall not replace it, nor shall he exchange it, either good with bad or bad with good; and if he indeed exchanges a domestic animal with a domestic animal, then it and its substitution shall be a holy object.

content: 11 But if it is any unclean animal from which they may not present an offering for Yahweh, then he shall present the animal before the priest.
content_old: 11 But if it is any unclean animal from which they may not present an offering for Yahweh, then he shall present the animal before the priest.

content: 12 And the priest shall set a value on it, either good or bad; as the priest sets your proper value, so it shall be.
content_old: 12 And the priest shall set a value on it, either good or bad; as the priest sets your proper value, so it shall be.

content: 13 And if he indeed wants to redeem it, then he shall add a fifth of it onto your proper value.
content_old: 13 And if he indeed wants to redeem it, then he shall add a fifth of it onto your proper value.

content: 14 “ ‘And if a man consecrates his house as a holy object for Yahweh, then the priest shall set a value on it, either good or bad; just as the priest sets a value on it, so it shall remain.
content_old: 14 “ ‘And if a man consecrates his house as a holy object for Yahweh, then the priest shall set a value on it, either good or bad; just as the priest sets a value on it, so it shall remain.

content: 15 But if the one who consecrates it wants to redeem his house, then he shall add a fifth of your proper value’s money onto it, and it shall be his.
content_old: 15 But if the one who consecrates it wants to redeem his house, then he shall add a fifth of your proper value’s money onto it, and it shall be his.

content: 16 “ ‘And if a man consecrates some of his property’s fields for Yahweh, then your proper value shall be in accordance with its seed requirements: a homer of barley seed for fifty shekels of money.
content_old: 16 “ ‘And if a man consecrates some of his property’s fields for Yahweh, then your proper value shall be in accordance with its seed requirements: a homer of barley seed for fifty shekels of money.

content: 17 If he consecrates his field from the Year of Jubilee, it shall stand as your proper value.
content_old: 17 If he consecrates his field from the Year of Jubilee, it shall stand as your proper value.

content: 18 But if he consecrates his field after the Jubilee, then the priest shall calculate the money for him according to the number of years that are left over until the Year of Jubilee; and it shall be deducted from your proper value.
content_old: 18 But if he consecrates his field after the Jubilee, then the priest shall calculate the money for him according to the number of years that are left over until the Year of Jubilee; and it shall be deducted from your proper value.

content: 19 And if he indeed redeems the field that is consecrated, then he shall add a fifth of your proper value’s money onto it, and it shall stand for him.
content_old: 19 And if he indeed redeems the field that is consecrated, then he shall add a fifth of your proper value’s money onto it, and it shall stand for him.

content: 20 And if he does not redeem the field and if he sells the field to another man, it may not be redeemed again,
content_old: 20 And if he does not redeem the field and if he sells the field to another man, it may not be redeemed again,

content: 21 and the field shall be a holy object for Yahweh when it goes out in the Jubilee, like a devoted field; it shall be the priest’s property.
content_old: 21 and the field shall be a holy object for Yahweh when it goes out in the Jubilee, like a devoted field; it shall be the priest’s property.

content: 22 “ ‘And if he consecrates for Yahweh his acquired field that is not the field of his inherited possession,
content_old: 22 “ ‘And if he consecrates for Yahweh his acquired field that is not the field of his inherited possession,

content: 23 then the priest shall calculate for him the amount of your proper value until the year of the Jubilee, and he shall give your proper value on that day as a holy object for Yahweh.
content_old: 23 then the priest shall calculate for him the amount of your proper value until the year of the Jubilee, and he shall give your proper value on that day as a holy object for Yahweh.

content: 24 In the Year of the Jubilee the field shall return to the one who bought it from him, to the one whose property the land is.
content_old: 24 In the Year of the Jubilee the field shall return to the one who bought it from him, to the one whose property the land is.

content: 25 And every proper value of yours shall be in the sanctuary’s shekel—the shekel shall be twenty gerahs.
content_old: 25 And every proper value of yours shall be in the sanctuary’s shekel—the shekel shall be twenty gerahs.

content: 26 “ ‘However, a man shall not consecrate a firstborn among livestock, which belongs as firstborn to Yahweh; whether an ox or small livestock, it is for Yahweh.
content_old: 26 “ ‘However, a man shall not consecrate a firstborn among livestock, which belongs as firstborn to Yahweh; whether an ox or small livestock, it is for Yahweh.

content: 27 And if it is among the unclean animals, then he shall ransom it according to your proper value, and he shall add a fifth of its value onto it; and if it is not redeemed, then it shall be sold according to your proper value.
content_old: 27 And if it is among the unclean animals, then he shall ransom it according to your proper value, and he shall add a fifth of its value onto it; and if it is not redeemed, then it shall be sold according to your proper value.

content: 28 However, anything devoted that a man has devoted to Yahweh from all that he has, from human or animal, or from the field of his property, may not be sold, and it may not be redeemed; anything devoted is a most holy thing for Yahweh.
content_old: 28 However, anything devoted that a man has devoted to Yahweh from all that he has, from human or animal, or from the field of his property, may not be sold, and it may not be redeemed; anything devoted is a most holy thing for Yahweh.

content: 29 Anyone devoted who is devoted from human beings cannot be ransomed—he shall surely be put to death.
content_old: 29 Anyone devoted who is devoted from human beings cannot be ransomed—he shall surely be put to death.

content: 30 “ ‘And any tithe of the land from the land’s seed or from the fruit of the trees is for Yahweh; it is a holy object for Yahweh.
content_old: 30 “ ‘And any tithe of the land from the land’s seed or from the fruit of the trees is for Yahweh; it is a holy object for Yahweh.

content: 31 And if a man indeed redeems from his tithe, he shall add a fifth of its value onto it.
content_old: 31 And if a man indeed redeems from his tithe, he shall add a fifth of its value onto it.

content: 32 As for every tithe of cattle or of the flock, all which crosses under the rod, the tenth shall be a holy object for Yahweh.
content_old: 32 As for every tithe of cattle or of the flock, all which crosses under the rod, the tenth shall be a holy object for Yahweh.

content: 33 He shall not inspect between the good and the bad, and he shall not exchange it; but if he indeed exchanges it, then it and its substitution shall be a holy object—it shall not be redeemed.’ ”
content_old: 33 He shall not inspect between the good and the bad, and he shall not exchange it; but if he indeed exchanges it, then it and its substitution shall be a holy object—it shall not be redeemed.’ ”
